page.title: 16RELIGIOUS INSTITUTIONS
page.content: Pentrecelyn Chapel was built in the year 1821 and it was re-built in 1874. The first minister of the chapel was the Reverend Evan Jones. The present minister is the Reverend D. S. Wynne. There are about 110 members in the chapel today and about 40 children. There are 6 deacons in the chapel. A Sunday School is held every Sunday. There are 7 classes. The three classes of children meet in the Vestry and the other 4 adult classes meet in the chapel.There is a kitchen and a Deacon's room. The chapel Secretary is Mr. Dewi Jones, Ty'n Llanfair and the Treasurer is Mr Gwyn Evans, Bro Helyn. The Sunday School's Superintendent is Mrs Mair Evans, Glascoed and the Deputy Superintendent is Mrs Beti Jones, Ty'n Llanfair. Capel-Y-Gloch stands about half a mile from Bethel C.M.
